website_summaries.verdict: Traction pads with deeper treads than other options for better grip on loose terrain.
pros: The exterior of the traction pads are UV treated to increase their long-term durability outdoors
Can handle vehicles up to 10 tons in weight before buckling
cons: Poor construction materials can lead to small cracks developing in the tops of the pads

customer_reviews.title: Like you're going to spend the money to have that ...
customer_reviews.text: You have to know that these are not the quality of the original Maxxtrax. They're plastic. Maxxtraxx are fiber-filled for extra strength and crack resistance, and these are not. At the time of purchase a pair of Maxxtrax was $340 and these were $110. You decide if the material difference is worth $230 or not. Price considered, this is a 5 star product. Maxxtraxx can be used for bridging, but you need to stack a few of them to get the strength required. Like you're going to spend the money to have that many right? These should really not be used for bridging at all given the material. It's a traction board, not a ramp. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jace Priester

customer_reviews.title: These are an awesome traction board and the price makes them even better
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for a couple months now and used them a few times. These are an awesome traction board and the price makes them even better. I drive a 94 Land Cruiser that’s petty well loaded and these had no issues in snow or mud. Was able to make a nice mount for the arb roof rack for about 70 bones. All in all I couldn’t be happier and for a fraction of the cost of their competitors. Highly recommend these boards. I have the gen3 and they measure 41 7/8” long x 12” wide x 2 1/2” high. Roughly 4” high when stacked.
customer_reviews.author: William J Connor

customer_reviews.title: Works great and built strong!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these tracks several times for self recoveries. I've never been stuck before, I love off-roading and have a very capable vehicle. Having these tracks added a sense of security when out on the trail. I began to take more chances and "Go For It! when coming to deep snow. Having the tracks to help with self recovery has worked every time! They are strong and durable. Any off-roader should have a set of these with them!
customer_reviews.author: Jayson Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Great quality/less expensive alternative to an overpriced product
customer_reviews.text: Nice tracks and less expensive than the excessively expensive alternatives. My only complaint about them is that they don't stack as flat as those expensive alternatives. I'm willing to make that sacrifice to save over $200 though. Work well and have had no issues with them. I tossed the bag as soon as I got them though as it felt cheap and like it would tear very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Bad A$$.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. In fact I let someone use them to get a full size truch with a truck camper in the bed, get out of some sand on the beach. I was sure they would break or crack. To my surprise they didnt.
customer_reviews.author: randy goss

customer_reviews.title: For price they couldn't be beat.
customer_reviews.text: These have definitely gotten me out of a sticky situation or two. Glad I picked them up instead of MaxTrax when comparing the costs. I will say I have already split the end of one of them but it still works fine. Only a 2 inch long crack. Some people want their recovery gear to be in perfect condition at all times I say if it still works then use it.
customer_reviews.author: SolidusPaulus

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Look great once I received them. Have not had a chance to test them out. Did have to contact seller. But they were great and quick to reapond. Will update after I get a chance to test them. They look pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Would order these again and again!
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the savings over the name brand ones!! These things are built tough. Keep them on my Jeep for insurance but used them more with my truck when remote camping! Love these things! The bag is nice but only used it until I mounted the tracks and had to take the bag off..
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Work Well
customer_reviews.text: With my 4x4 van these have helped get me out of some sticky situations, and even used as insurance to go over some uncertain track - extremely deep rutted areas. Overall happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Good in the winter
customer_reviews.text: Just as good as maxx Less money same concept only use them in the winter
customer_reviews.author: cms

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Traction Boards
customer_reviews.text: These worked stellar in some snow wheeling. Absolutely stoked with these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price and definitely a reusable system
customer_reviews.text: You definitely get what you pay for! It’s a little thicker and once the teeth are worn they are worn. Great product for your value, I’ve used it a few times but I think of it like this, you you can get three to 4 uses out of it you made your money!
customer_reviews.author: Nopian

customer_reviews.title: Good value, work well
customer_reviews.text: Have used these multiple times off-road when stuck or to “bridge” over obstacles. Much simpler and faster to deploy than a winch. Knocked a star off as the plastic shows a little sign of fatigue and too much wheelspin can tear off some of the little knobs. I would buy again if I wear these out
customer_reviews.author: MILT

customer_reviews.title: XBULL review
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet, but it is a lot heavier and sturdier than I expected.. Color Black
customer_reviews.author: Tell it like it is..

customer_reviews.title: Durable and not as expensive as other tracks
customer_reviews.text: These tracks are awesome!! What a great, well-made product and definitely a perfect alternative to the very expensive MaxTraxx. Comes with a nice durable carrying case if you don't want to mount them.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Flexible
customer_reviews.text: Little short but flexible enough..dont brake or crack like plastics
customer_reviews.author: Samysamy

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Broke six studs off on the first use, good price, much better than nothing, but not top quality
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Wow, more than I was expecting. These are ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow , more than I was expecting. These are on par with the ones I had that were way more expensive. That set is buried out on a "dry " lake a few years back. This time I will tie a rope to them and my bumper so they won't get left behind!
customer_reviews.author: Tombstone17

customer_reviews.title: Cracked and sent wrong color, but they work
customer_reviews.text: I used it in mud and sand. It worked like it is supposed to but after the first day of use it already had a large cracks on one end. Also the seller sent me the wrong color and I had no time to return since I needed them that weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, well built
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Never owned the big name brand ones but for my needs(occasional use) these are perfectly fine. So far they have held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Tewkesbury

customer_reviews.title: Mounted to Prinsu
customer_reviews.text: Luckily haven’t had to use them but they feel and look great! Mounted great to the prinsu rack on top of my Tacoma. Would definitely recommend these boards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on sand
customer_reviews.text: Used these to rescue some city folk from an outer banks beach. They seem a little light weight but we made sure that they were supported end to end
customer_reviews.author: Robin L Lair

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if they exactly math the quality of Maxtraxx, but for 1/3 the cost they work great
customer_reviews.author: Dylan E Davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice seems to be well made Not maxtrax but we shall see how well they work
customer_reviews.author: GrumpyCoffee

customer_reviews.title: Traction action gets you unstuck
customer_reviews.text: You never want to use. But the quality of the product gives me confidence if I or someone else gets stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts but decent boards.
customer_reviews.text: It did not come with the mounting screws and bracket as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: tk

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Works well. No need to spend big money on top line boards
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Work just as good as the expensive ones. Where I come from people use plywood. The fact that people spend 350 on main brand boards absolutely confuses me. These work great. Use them with my half ton truck and never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle O

customer_reviews.title: They work, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Broke first time using them in the snow. Full size pickup truck. Definitely will have to air down the tires to get traction in the cold as the studs aren’t super grabby.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Already used them 4 times and they worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Rico911

customer_reviews.title: Worth driving over
customer_reviews.text: Did the job. Sturdy enough to drive over and park on for days.
customer_reviews.author: Photo guy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for getting out of the muck
customer_reviews.text: Solid built product that the Aussie's have been using for awhile! Perfect for getting out of the muck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Cheaper, but better option than the more expensive competitor.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Company, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE!! I ordered these before a back country snowboarding/camping trip XBULL got them to me before I left for my trip.They were a huge help while getting out of snowbanks. So much more affordable than MaxTraxx and I have not had a problem with the studs wearing out. I reviewed these on my Instagram (@4estrunner) for durability and they held up the weight of the car while planked between two ramps.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: seems weak, but great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but looks a little bit "cheaper" than the original expensive characters in the market. I can tell that it work work superbly on beach sand. What I worry about is in slippery mud that sits on top of hard compacted clay. Not looking to tough for that. But won't know until I try it....
customer_reviews.author: J Cox

customer_reviews.title: Best buy
customer_reviews.text: Best idea ever. I'm using them for my f350 4x4
customer_reviews.author: Frank Soliz

customer_reviews.title: Storage is an issue.
customer_reviews.text: The tracks look to be robust and I think will work great. The biggest complaint is the storage of them. They do not stack flat like Maxtrax do. So if you are trying to stack 4 of these together on a mount expect it to be about 8 inches thick. This is a big deal on an overland type vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: amp

customer_reviews.title: TRED and Maxtrax are all much more expensive but it's hard to put a price on an easy recovery from a "no traction" situation
customer_reviews.text: You can't find traction boards for THIS cheap anywhere else. TRED and Maxtrax are all much more expensive but it's hard to put a price on an easy recovery from a "no traction" situation. I have NOT used these yet but just from a build quality/sturdy/feel perspective they are VERY solid and stout. These are actually quite heavy and the carrying case is a nice extra. I'm excited to use them but I also don't want to have to use them.
customer_reviews.author: mtbiker89

customer_reviews.title: Ships wrong color and "orange" looks like salmon color
customer_reviews.text: Product resembles other reviews and appears to be worth the price compared to more expensive options. One star reduced because they shipped "orange" instead of black. (Read the reviews and you'll see it happens frequently) Another star reduced because their "orange" more closely resembles a salmon color.
customer_reviews.author: Todd R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t had to test them yet, but the quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had to test them yet, but the quality and feel of these kept me confident on this week’s adventure. Cheap insurance for sand and mud. Packs surprisingly well in back of Jeep or on roof rack considering how beefy they are.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Scott

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in September figuring they might come in handy when the snow arrives. Sure enough I got stuck in a drift yesterday and I tried using the xbull tracks to get out. One of them cracked in half on the very first attempt.
customer_reviews.author: drone dog

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: These things are horrible. Used once and just feel A part . I don’t recommend you buy these spend a little more and get good Quality .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont do it
customer_reviews.text: These things suck. Trashed them the first time I used them. Spent 5hours digging my truck out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Split Down the Middle
customer_reviews.text: Using against flat rock face as barrier between rear tire/big rock face to climb while winching, snapped in half. Lame product.. also nubs burned off quick, minimal amount of spinning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Item shipped without carrying case
customer_reviews.text: Item was missing the carrying case as pictured. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: vincent cortese

customer_reviews.title: Country of Origin
customer_reviews.text: Proudly and boldly stamped "Made in China" on the shipping box. May want to isolate and decontaminate before handling.
customer_reviews.author: S

product_meta.title: X-BULL New Recovery Traction Tracks Sand Mud Snow Track Tire Ladder 4WD (3Gen, Black)
feature_bullets: Raised tracks help prevent vehicle tires from spinning on snow, sand, mud or ice
Prevent your vehicle's tires from spinning when stuck in snow, mud or sand
